Question_1.Question: What was the maximum weight loss due to biodegradation of Av-cl-poly(AA) after 70 days using the soil burial method?
Question_1.Source: Maximum weight loss due to biodegradation of Av-cl-poly(AA) was found to be 90% after 70 days.

Question_2.Question: What was the maximum weight loss due to biodegradation of Av-cl-poly(AA) after 70 days using the composting method?
Question_2.Source: Maximum weight loss due to biodegradation of Av-cl-poly(AA) through the composting method was found to be 94% after 70 days.

Question_3.Question: What was the maximum weight loss due to biodegradation of Av-cl-poly(AA) after 70 days using the vermicomposting method?
Question_3.Source: Maximum weight loss due to biodegradation of Av-cl-poly(AA) with vermicomposting method was found to be 93% after 70 days.

Question_4.Question: Which method showed the highest biodegradation percentage after 70 days?
Question_4.D: All methods showed the same percentage
Question_4.Source: Maximum biodegradation was found to be 90%, 94%, and 93% in case of soil burial, composting, and vermicomposting methods, respectively.

Question_5.Context: Release kinetics of dichlorvos through the polymer matrices
Question_5.Question: What was the maximum release of dichlorvos through Av-cl-poly(AA) after 44 hours?
Question_5.Source: The results showed that maximum release of dichlorvos was found to be 1024.34 ppm after 44 hours.

Question_6.Context: Water retention capacity of soil through Av-cl-poly(AA)
Question_6.Question: How many days did the water retention capacity of soil using synthesized Av-cl-poly(AA) prolong from 11 to 20 days?
Question_6.Source: Water retention capacity prolonged from 11 to 20 days using synthesized Av-cl-poly(AA).

Question_7.Context: Water uptake by soil samples using swollen Av-cl-poly(AA)
Question_7.Question: What was the increase in water content of the clay soil after adding 1% swollen Av-cl-poly(AA)?
Question_7.Source: The addition of 1% swollen Av-cl-poly(AA) in dry clay soil led to an increase in water content to 6.1%.

Question_8.Context: Impact of biodegradation of synthesized hydrogel on soil
Question_8.Question: What was the change in organic carbon content in the soil after the degradation of Av-cl-poly(AA)?
Question_8.Source: There is an increase in the content (0.36%) of % organic carbon in the soil having degraded hydrogel as compared to the control soil.

Question_9.Context: Impact of biodegradation of synthesized hydrogel on soil
Question_9.Question: What was the change in potassium content in the soil after the degradation of Av-cl-poly(AA)?
Question_9.Source: Potassium in the control soil sample was 59 g/m2, but in the Av-cl-poly(AA) degraded soil, it was 60 g/m2.

Question_10.Context: Impact of biodegradation of synthesized hydrogel on soil
Question_10.Question: What was the change in pH of the soil after the degradation of Av-cl-poly(AA)?
Question_10.Source: The pH was 6.9 in the control sample, and it was 6.7 in the soil with degraded hydrogel.
